Articles.Content:
Ever wanted to return a probe with a rock sample from Duna? Have the stubby Kerbal mitts let you down once again? Were you wishing for a more precise robotic drill? Would you prefer Jeb to stay on Kerbin dressed as a girl?

Look no further, the Robotic Planetary Sample craft is here to bring back rock samples from Duna, back to Kerbin for SCIENCE! The craft may look lopsided, but I assure you, it's COM is well balanced! (warranty void when decoupled).

Here's a video featuring my latest adventure!

Download Link

Protip: To launch the Duna ascent stage, first decouple the node from the docking port to release the rocket. Then press 1 to activate the landing legs and bring the rocket into an upright position.

Amazing work.

To anybody curious, the clouds are from the Universe Replacer mod. Just search on that thread.

Amazing work.

To anybody curious, the clouds are from the Universe Replacer mod. Just search on that thread.

Thanks, I hope you have fun with this one

The fuel flow issue in the video was me forgetting to separate the docking port with decouplers. It's been fixed when I started posting in the OP, so you wouldn't need to worry about it
Oh god, the command and conquer generals soundtrack brings back so much memories. Amazing work, tho I doubt it would run very well on my Mac.
the is amazing especially for a single launch.
I love how you uprighted and launched the Duna ascent vehicle. Looked like ICBM technology.
I like the idea of the dockable heat shield. never thought of that before.

*hears Command and Conquer Generals Soundtrack* OMIGOD! EBEEBEBEBEBEJEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEB! *Temporarily dies, transforms into 10 year old child again, finds disk, plays game, realises how terrible it is now, quits game, plays KSP*

Worth it just for soundtrack, but seriously, both that game and this craft are incredible.

I love how you uprighted and launched the Duna ascent vehicle. Looked like ICBM technology.
I like the idea of the dockable heat shield. never thought of that before.

Haha. Thanks, they were kinda hairbrained ideas I had while sitting in the toilet of all places. My mind wanders a lot when I'm taking a long poo
Ugh I just spent the entire afternoon building something like those uprighting missiles. Took ages to get it (sort of) right.

@levelord Lovely craft. +1-ed it on youtube too. anyway: I like my clipping and I am wondering how you managed to have this crossed tanks. You used something similar on your LMV

W

@levelord Lovely craft. +1-ed it on youtube too. anyway: I like my clipping and I am wondering how you managed to have this crossed tanks. You used something similar on your LMV

W

Thanks! I'm glad you liked it

I've basically placed cubic octagonal struts on the side and rotated the fuel tanks so that their attachment points align, then I place them there.
I'll just download your Craft file.. Cr*p this job is getting in the way of my Space Program :-/
With the advent of 0.22 Now I have to figure out how to convert this into a science-capable vessel using the lowest tech possible. gaaaah!
This was pretty awesome! Good job, great ingenuity!
So when are we getting something new to look at? even your youtube channel has been quiet.:-(
With the advent of 0.22 now i have to figure out how to convert it into space combating vessel.
